module.name: LC CCI User Tools
module.description: A set of tools providing functionality to convert, aggregate and subset LC map and condition products.
module.changelog: Changes in 3.10: - aggreagte-map tool can now be used with additional user map and conversion table in order to improve PFTs - improved validation of user provided look-up tables - if Java is not installed a "1.6)" file has been created containing "java not installed" message - fixed evaluation of JAVA_LOCATION in batch scripts Changes in 3.8: - variable metadata of WB NetCDF corrected, fill value NaN replaced by -1 for count bands - checks added to ensure that cross walking tables contain the correct sequence and number of LCCS classes. Changes in 3.7: - removed the rules for the map products - updated readme.txt to explain the file format of cross walking table better - fixed scaling in remap tool - added NetCDF conversion of WB products Changes in 3.6: - fixed fractional area calculation when observation or bin crossed the anti-meridian - fixed java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unknown metadata aggregator name: null Changes in 3.5: - added remapping tool for remapping LC classes to PFT classes - LCCS legend in NetCDF files updated to contain additional classes, e.g. 152, 153, ... - default cross walking table (LUT) updated to cover the additional classes Changes in 3.4: - set super sampling value correctly Changes in 3.3: - added aggregation rules for ndvi, ba and snow - updated flags with filled_ice for ndvi - include pixel state clear_snow_ice in valid expression (rule) for map aggregation - Renamed accuracy to confidence - Supporting comment line in user PFT table - Allow subsetting when aggregating map and condition products Changes in 3.2: - added parameter for cache size to shell scripts - added parameter 'targetDir' to conversion tool - LUT for PFTs requires now LCCS class as first column - support for subsetting condition products - consolidated metadata - added more logging information - improved speed of writing to NetCDF - introduced property for slice height - reduced even more memory consumption - support for aggregating ba and snow condition - adapted names of aggregated condition variables Changes in 3.1: - fixed to high memory consumption when doing aggregation <!--
